compoundStructure: bhagavat (Lord) + gai (song) - tatpurusha compound
dus (bad/hard) + yodhana (fighting)- compound name
pāṇḍu + a (patronymic suffix)
kuru + a (patronymic suffix)
sam (together/complete) + ji (to conquer) - compound name
dhṛ (to hold) + rāṣṭra (kingdom) - compound name meaning 'one who holds the kingdom'
draupad + ī (feminine suffix)
yudhi (in battle) + sthira (firm) - compound name meaning 'firm in battle'
saha (with) + deva (god) - compound name
abhi (towards) + man (to think/esteem) - compound name
pari (around) + kṣi (to guard) - compound name
jana (people) + ji (to conquer) - compound name meaning 'conqueror of people'
man + uṣya (agent noun)
duh (to milk/feed) + itṛ (agent suffix)
pā (to protect) + tṛ (agent suffix)
mā (to measure/give) + tṛ (agent suffix)
bhrā (to nourish) + tṛ (agent suffix)
svas (to protect) + ṛ (feminine suffix)
su (good) + hṛd (heart) - compound meaning 'one of good heart'
veda (knowledge) + anta (end) - compound meaning 'end of knowledge'
smṛ (to remember) + ti (feminine noun suffix)
śru (to hear) + ti (feminine noun suffix)
iti (thus) + ha (indeed) + asa (he said) - liturgical compound meaning 'thus indeed it was said'
purā (before) + aṇa (diminutive suffix)
kavi (poet) + ya (verbal suffix)
naṭ (to act) + aka (diminutive suffix)
ā (prefix) + śram (to work/toil) + a (noun suffix)
jan (to be born) + ti (feminine noun suffix)
rāj (to rule) + tra (noun suffix)
diś (to point out/direct) + a (noun suffix)
pṛth (to spread) + vī (feminine suffix)
svar (to shine) + ya (verbal suffix)
cand (to shine) + ra (verbal suffix)
nakṣ (to approach) + tra (noun suffix)
grah (to seize) + a (noun suffix)
a (negative prefix) + kāś (to shine) + a (noun suffix) - literally 'that which does not shine'
var (to cover) + uṇa (verbal suffix)
śī (to prosper) + va (verbal suffix)
śak (to be able) + ti (feminine noun suffix)
div (to shine) + ī (feminine suffix)
lakṣ (to observe) + mī (feminine suffix)
saras (pool) + vatī (possessive feminine suffix)
gaṇa (troops/numbers) + īśa (lord) - 'lord of troops'
kṛt (to make/do) + i (feminine) + keya (verbal suffix) - associated with Krittikas (Pleiades)
han (to kill/damage) + u (diminutive) + mān (participle suffix) - literally 'one with prominent jaw' or 'one who subdued pride'
ram (to please) + a (verbal suffix) - 'one who pleases'
sīt (to plow) + ā (feminine suffix)
lakṣ (to observe) + maṇa (verbal suffix)
bhṛ (to bear) + ta (verbal suffix)
śatru (enemy) + han (to kill) - 'enemy-killer'
ru (to cry/make sound) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'one who makes terrifying sounds'
valmīka (anthill) + i (agent suffix) - 'one born from an anthill'
vyas (to divide/separate) + a (verbal suffix)
vid (to know) + a (verbal suffix)
ṛc (verse) + veda (knowledge) - 'knowledge of verses'
yaj (to sacrifice) + veda (knowledge) - 'knowledge of sacrifice'
sāman (song) + veda (knowledge) - 'knowledge of songs'
atharvan (a sage) + veda (knowledge) - 'knowledge of Atharvan'
upa (near) + ni (down) + sad (to sit) - 'sitting near' (for instruction)
brahman (sacred word/sound) + aṇa (verbal suffix)
araṇya (forest) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'forest texts'
siv (to sew/weave) + tra (instrumental suffix) - 'that with which one sews/weaves'
dharma (duty/righteousness) + śāstra (teaching/scripture) - compound meaning 'scripture on dharma'
artha (wealth/purpose) + śāstra (teaching/scripture) - compound meaning 'scripture on wealth'
kāma (desire/love) + śāstra (teaching/scripture) - compound meaning 'scripture on desire'
mi (intensive prefix) + man (to think) + ṃsā (feminine noun suffix) - 'deep consideration'
nī (to lead) + ya (verbal suffix) + prefixed with 'nya' - 'correct leading' or 'method'
vi (apart) + śiṣ (to remain/excel) + ika (verbal suffix)
saṃ (together) + khyā (to appear/declare) - 'together declare' or 'enumerate'
bhaj (to serve) + ktṛ + i (feminine suffix)
jñā (to know) + ana (verbal suffix)
dhyai (to contemplate) + ana (verbal suffix)
prāṇa (life force/breath) + āyāma (extension/restraint) - 'extension or control of breath'
ā (intensive prefix) + s (to sit) + ana (verbal suffix)
mud (to delight) + rā (feminine suffix)
man (to think) + tra (instrumental suffix)
yam (to control) + tra (instrumental suffix)
tan (to spread) + tra (instrumental suffix)
pūj (to honor) + ā (feminine suffix)
hu (to pour/give) + a (verbal suffix)
yaj (to worship) + ya (verbal suffix)
dakṣ (to be able) + iṇa (feminine suffix) - originally 'right' or 'proper', then 'gift given to the right person'
kṣat (to harm/damage) + rya (verbal suffix) - 'protector' (one who protects from harm)
viś (to enter/possess) + ya (verbal suffix)
śūd (to cover/protect) + ra (verbal suffix)
sahas (to excel) + ra (verbal suffix)
a (prefix) + yut (to join) + a (verbal suffix)
lakṣ (to observe/aim) + a (verbal suffix) - 'that which is aimed at' or 'mark'
koṭ (to break/cut) + i (feminine suffix)
arbud (to swell) + a (verbal suffix)
kharv (to be crooked) + a (verbal suffix)
mah (to be great) + ā (feminine suffix)
ut (up) + mā (to measure) + a (adjective suffix) - 'highest measuring'
madhya (middle) + ma (suffix for 'possessing')
comp. form of kanīyān (comparative of 'small')
gam (to go) + participle jagat (going) - 'that which goes/flows'
bhū (to be/become) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'that which becomes'
lok (to look at) + a (noun suffix)
a (negative prefix) + lok (to look) + a (noun suffix) - 'that which causes to look' or 'light'
sat (to be) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'that which is real'
a (negative prefix) + satya (truth) - 'non-truth'
a (negative prefix) + śubha (auspicious) - 'inauspicious'
puṇy (to purify) + a (verbal suffix) - 'that which purifies'
pāp (to harm) + a (verbal suffix) - 'injurious act'
su (good) + kh (to pierce/dig) + a (noun suffix) - 'that which is easy to bear' or 'ease'
duḥ (bad/difficult) + kh (to pierce) + a (noun suffix) - 'that which is difficult to bear' or 'pain'
ā (intensive prefix) + nand (to rejoice) + a (verbal suffix)
śam (to calm) + ti (feminine noun suffix)
pri (to love) + ma (intensive verbal suffix)
krudh (to be angry) + a (verbal suffix)
lubh (to desire) + a (verbal suffix)
muh (to be deluded) + a (verbal suffix)
mad (to be drunk/joyful) + a (verbal suffix)
matsar (to be jealous) + a (verbal suffix)
dā (to give) + ana (verbal suffix)
day (to show compassion) + ā (feminine suffix)
kṣam (to forgive/endure) + ā (feminine suffix)
śrad (to trust) + dhā (to hold) + ā (feminine suffix)
vīr (to be heroic) + ya (verbal suffix)
tij (to shine) + as (verbal suffix)
oj (to be strong) + as (verbal suffix)
bal (to be strong) + a (verbal suffix)
medh (to sacrifice/dedicate) + ā (feminine suffix)
pra (forth) + jñā (to know) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'true knowledge'
cit (to think) + ta (verbal suffix) + a (verbal suffix) - 'that which is thought of/believed'
vi (apart/distinctly) + jñā (to know) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'distinctive knowledge'
anu (after/following) + bhū (to be) + a (verbal suffix) - 'that which follows being'
prati (towards) + akṣ (to perceive) + a (verbal suffix) - literally 'that which is toward the eye', meaning 'before the eye' or 'direct perception'
anu (after) + mā (to measure) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'measuring after' or 'inference'
śabd (to go sound) + a (verbal suffix)
upa (near) + mā (to measure) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'measuring near' or 'comparison'
artha (meaning/purpose) + āpatti (falling/obtaining) - compound meaning 'obtaining meaning'
anu (after) + upa (near) + labh (to obtain) + i (feminine suffix) - literally 'non-obtaining'
pra (correctly) + mā (to measure) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'correct measurement' or 'valid proof'
pra (correctly) + mā (to measure) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'correct measurement'
a (negative prefix) + pra (correctly) + mā (to measure) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'incorrect measurement'
saṃ (together) + śī (to sleep/stop) + a (verbal suffix) - 'conflicting thoughts'
vi (intensive) + par (to cross) + i (to go) + aya (verbal suffix) - 'going wrong way' or 'error'
ni (down) + drā (to sleep) + ā (feminine suffix)
vāc (speech) + k (feminine suffix from root 'vac' to speak)
vac (to speak) + as (verbal suffix)
nad (to sound) + a (verbal suffix)
a (negative prefix) + kṣar (to flow/decay) + a (verbal suffix) - 'imperishable' (the letter that doesn't decay)
vāc (speech) + ya (verbal suffix)
tat (that) + tva (abstract noun suffix) - 'the nature of that' or 'truth'
pada (word) + artha (meaning) - 'meaning of a word' or 'category'
dru (to flow) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'that which flows' or 'substance'
guṇ (to wind around/attribute) + a (verbal suffix)
samāna (same/common) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'commonness' or 'generality'
vi (apart) + śiṣ (to excel) + a (verbal suffix) - 'excelling apart' or 'distinction'
sam (together) + ava (down) + i (to go) + aya (verbal suffix) - 'connection or inherence'
a (negative prefix) + bhāva (from bhū to be) - 'non-being' or 'absence'
sat (to be) + tā (abstract feminine suffix) - 'the nature of being'
upa (near) + dhā (to hold) + i (feminine suffix) - 'imposed limitation'
anta (end) + ya (verbal suffix)
param (highest/supreme) + a (adjective suffix)
a (negative prefix) + param (highest) - 'not the highest'
sa (with) + guṇa (qualities) - 'with qualities'
niḥ (without) + guṇa (qualities) - 'without qualities'
sa (with) + ākāra (form) - 'with form'
niḥ (without) + ākāra (form) - 'without form'
sa (with) + kala (parts) - 'with parts'
niḥ (without) + kalā (parts) - 'without parts'
pṝ (to fill) + ṇa (verbal suffix)
a (negative prefix) + pūrṇa (full) - 'not full'
an (negative prefix) + anta (end) - 'without end'
pari (around) + mā (to measure) + it (past participle suffix) - 'measured around' or 'limited'
kāl (to calculate/destine) + a (verbal suffix)
kṛ (to do/make) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'that by which something is done'
kṛ (to do/make) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'that which is done'
hi (to sacrifice) + tu (verbal suffix) - 'that which causes sacrifice' or 'cause'
phal (to bloom/produce fruit) + a (verbal suffix)
ni (down) + mṛ (to die/fall) + ita (past participle) - literally 'that which has fallen down' or 'reason'
upa (near/towards) + dā (to give) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'that which is taken/given as material'
a (negative prefix) + dṛś (to see) + ta (past participle suffix) - 'not seen'
pra (forward) + rabh (to begin) + dha (past participle suffix) - 'that which has been begun'
sam (together) + ci (to gather) + ta (past participle suffix) - 'that which has been gathered together'
ā (towards) + gam (to go) + i (present participle suffix) - 'that which is coming'
mā (to measure/measure out) + yā (feminine suffix) - 'that which measures out' or 'creative power'
a (negative prefix) + vid (to know) + yā (feminine suffix) - 'non-knowledge'
vid (to know) + yā (feminine suffix)
jīv (to live) + a (verbal suffix)
īś (to rule/own) + vara (best) - 'best ruler' or 'God'
pra (before) + kṛ (to make) + ti (feminine suffix) - 'that which is created first' or 'primordial nature'
mah (to be great) + at (verbal suffix) - 'the great one' (in Samkhya philosophy, the cosmic intelligence)
aham (I) + kāra (from kṛ to make) - 'I-maker' or 'ego-consciousness'
man (to think) + as (verbal suffix)
indra (lord) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'belonging to Indra' (the senses are called Indriyas as they are under the control of Indra as the mind)
tat (that) + mātra (measure) - 'that measure' or 'subtle elements'
bhū (to be/become) + ta (verbal suffix) - 'that which has become' or 'existent being'
pañca (five) + bhautika (relating to elements) - 'five-elemented'
anna (food) + maya (made of) - 'made of food'
prāṇa (life force) + maya (made of) - 'made of life force'
manas (mind) + maya (made of) - 'made of mind'
vijñāna (consciousness) + maya (made of) - 'made of consciousness'
ānanda (bliss) + maya (made of) - 'made of bliss'
kuś (to cover) + a (verbal suffix) - 'covering' or 'sheath'
sūkṣma (subtle) + śarīra (body) - compound meaning 'subtle body'
sthūla (gross) + śarīra (body) - compound meaning 'gross body'
kāraṇa (cause) + śarīra (body) - compound meaning 'causal body'
jīva (living being) + ātman (self) - compound meaning 'living self'
param (supreme) + ātman (self) - compound meaning 'supreme self'
antar (within) + yam (to control) + in (agent suffix) - 'one who controls from within'
sākṣ (to see/testify) + in (agent suffix) - 'one who witnesses'
dṛś (to see) + ṭā (agent suffix) - 'the seer'
śru (to hear) + tā (agent suffix) - 'the hearer'
man (to think) + tā (agent suffix) - 'the thinker'
vi (distinctly) + jñā (to know) + tā (agent suffix) - 'the distinct knower'
kṛ (to do) + tā (agent suffix)
bhuj (to enjoy) + tā (agent suffix)
sukh (happy) + tā (feminine agent suffix)
duḥkh (sorrow) + itā (feminine suffix) - 'one who experiences sorrow'
muc (to release) + tā (feminine agent suffix) - 'one who is released'
bandh (to bind) + dha (past participle suffix) - 'one who is bound'
muc (to release) + kṣu (desiderative suffix) + u (desirous suffix) - 'one who desires to be released'
jñā (to know) + kṣu (desiderative suffix) + u (desirous suffix) - 'one who desires to know'
sādh (to accomplish) + aka (agent suffix) - 'one who accomplishes'
sidh (to accomplish) + dha (past participle suffix) - 'one who is accomplished'
ava (down) + tṝ (to cross) + a (verbal suffix) - 'descent'
vi (apart) + bhū (to become) + ti (feminine suffix) - 'special manifestation'
līl (to play) + ā (feminine suffix)
sādh (to accomplish) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'that by which one accomplishes'
abhi (towards) + āsa (from as to sit) - 'sitting near' or 'practice'
vi (away) + rāg (to color/love) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'absence of passion'
sam (completely) + ā (towards) + dhā (to place) + i (feminine suffix) - 'complete placing of mind on one object'
keval (alone/isolated) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'state of aloneness/liberation'
niḥ (out) + vā (to blow) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'blowing out' or 'extinction of desires'
brahman (Brahman) + loka (world) - compound meaning 'world of Brahman'
vai (intensive prefix) + kuṇṭha (to be crooked/incurved) - 'the place free from crookedness' or 'heaven of Vishnu'
kailās (Kailash) + a (verbal suffix) - 'mountain of Shiva'
a (negative prefix) + mṛ (to die) + ta (verbal suffix) - 'the undying' or 'nectar of immortality'
su (to press out) + ma (verbal suffix) - 'the pressed one' (referring to the sacred moon deity and soma plant)
sur (to be bright) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'the intoxicating drink'
mad (to be drunk/joyful) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'that which intoxicates'
māṃs (flesh) + a (verbal suffix)
matsya (fish) - from the root meaning 'to dive/swim'
mith (to join) + una (verbal suffix) - 'union' (specifically sexual union)
pañca (five) + makāra (the letter 'M') - 'the five Ms' (in Tantric context)
ni (down) + ā (towards) + as (to throw) + a (verbal suffix) - 'placement' or 'ceremonial positioning'
puras (before) + cara (to go) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'practice performed beforehand'
jap (to mutter/repeat) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the act of repeated recitation'
tṛp (to satisfy) + aṇa (verbal suffix) - 'the act of satisfying'
śraddhā (faith) + dha (verbal suffix) - 'done with faith' (ritual performed for deceased ancestors)
piṇḍ (to conglomerate) + a (verbal suffix) - 'lump' or 'ball' (especially in ritual context)
tṝ (to cross) + tha (verbal suffix) - 'a place of crossing' or 'pilgrimage site'
yā (to go) + trā (feminine suffix) - 'the act of going' or 'pilgrimage'
dṛś (to see) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'seeing' or 'philosophical system'
spṛś (to touch) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'the act of touching'
sev (to serve) + ā (feminine suffix)
arc (to worship) + ana (verbal suffix)
vand (to praise) + ana (verbal suffix)
namas (bowing) + kāra (maker) - literally 'making bowed hands' or 'salutation'
pra (forward) + nam (to bow) + a (verbal suffix) - 'prostration'
as (to be) + tu (optative particle) - 'may it be'
bhū (to become) + vat (possessive suffix) - literally 'may you be' or 'sir/madam'
bhū (to be) + oḥ (vocative particle) - 'calling attention' or 'oh'
he (interjectional root) - used to call attention
aho (interjectional root) - expressing wonder or surprise
ha (interjectional root) repeated - expressing laughter or derision
han (to strike) + ta (verbal suffix) - expressing sorrow or regret
dhik (interjectional root) - expressing contempt
aśva (horse) - from root related to 'to go' or 'speed'
gaj (to go) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the one that goes' (referring to elephant)
nṛ (to move) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the one who moves' or 'man'
nārī (woman) - from 'nara' (man) with feminine suffix
paś (to see) + u (noun suffix) - 'the one that sees' or 'beast' (as opposed to 'deva' which sees)
pakṣ (wing) + i (noun suffix) - 'winged one' or 'bird'
sṛp (to crawl) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the one that crawls' or 'snake'
mṛg (to hunt/seek) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the one that seeks' (deer, which constantly looks for food)
van (to cover/protect) + a (verbal suffix) - 'covered land' or 'forest'
araṇya (forest) - from root meaning 'without' or 'not home' (wilderness)
gir (to praise) + i (noun suffix) - 'the praised one' (mountains were praised in Vedic literature)
nad (to flow) + ī (feminine suffix) - 'the flowing one'
sāgara (ocean) - literally 'the gathering place of rivers' (from 'sa' + 'gara')
dvi (two) + īpa (island) - 'island' (perhaps referring to land dividing water)
path (to go) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the going place' or 'path'
mṛg (to follow/hunt) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the path followed' or 'way'
vīthi (street) - from root meaning 'to go in succession'
sabh (to speak) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'the speaking place' or 'assembly hall'
gṛh (to grasp/protect) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the protective place' or 'house'
pra (forward) + sad (to go/enter) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the excellent dwelling' or 'palace'
harmya (building) - from root related to 'to harm' in the sense of 'protected from harm'
bhū (to be/become) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'the place of being' or 'dwelling'
ā (towards) + lī (to be hidden) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the place where one goes to hide/rest' or 'abode'
ni (down) + lī (to be hidden) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the place where one settles' or 'abode'
vi (in) + as (to stay) + ma (verbal suffix) - 'the place where one enters to stay' or 'house'
gih (to live) + a (verbal suffix) - 'the living place' or 'house'
dhā (to place) + ma (verbal suffix) - 'the placed place' or 'abode', often divine
kṣi (to cut/drain) + tra (verbal suffix) - 'that which is cut/drained' or 'cultivated field'
ā (towards) + yat (to go) + ana (verbal suffix) - 'place of going toward' or 'abode'
mand (to be happy) + ira (verbal suffix) - 'the place of joy' or 'temple'
deva (god) + ālaya (abode) - compound meaning 'abode of gods' or 'temple'
cit (to think/remember) + ya (verbal suffix) - 'that which is remembered' (especially Buddha or sacred)
stūp (to heap up) + a (verbal suffix) - 'heaped up place' or 'stupa'
vi (in different ways) + hṛ (to go) + a (verbal suffix) - 'wandering place' or 'monastery'
math (to measure/limit) + a (verbal suffix) - 'measured place' or 'monastery'
kuṭ (to be crooked) + īra (verbal suffix) - 'crooked place' or 'hut'
parṇa (leaf) + śālā (house) - compound meaning 'leaf house' or 'leaf hut'
yajña (sacrifice) + śālā (hall) - compound meaning 'sacrifice hall'
saṃ (with) + sthā (to stand) + ā (feminine suffix) - 'established place' or 'institution'
sam (together) + i (to go) + ti (feminine suffix) - 'coming together' or 'assembly'
pari (around) + sad (to go/sit) + d (verbal suffix) - 'sitting around' or 'assembly'
gaṇ (to count) + a (verbal suffix) - 'group' or 'assembly'
saṃ (together) + han (to strike/gather) + gha (verbal suffix) - 'gathered together' or 'community'
mil (to meet/unite) + a (verbal suffix) - 'meeting place' or 'gathering'
ut (up) + sū (to press/gather) + ava (verbal suffix) - 'pressing up' or 'festival'
maha (great) + utsava (festival) - compound meaning 'great festival'
parv (to be prominent) + a (verbal suffix) - 'prominent occasion' or 'festival'
dina (day) - from root meaning 'to give light' or 'to shine'
rātri (night) - from root meaning 'to give pleasure' or 'rest'
ahar (day) + rātri (night) - compound meaning 'day-night' or 'continuously'
pakṣ (wing) + a (verbal suffix) - 'wing' or 'side', specifically 'half-month' as moon's phases
māsa (month) - from root related to moon 'mās' (moon)
ṛtu (season) - from root meaning 'order' or 'regularity'
saṃ (together) + vas (to dwell/remain) + tra (verbal suffix) - 'that which passes completely' or 'year'
yuj (to join/unite) + a (verbal suffix) - 'a joining period' or 'cosmic age'
satya (truth) + yuga (age) - compound meaning 'age of truth' or golden age'
na (not) - simple negation particle
sa (that) - demonstrative pronoun in masculine nominative

grammaticalAnalysis: feminine/neuter plural nom./voc. or 2nd person dual dat./acc.
compoundStructure: tvam (you) + e (personal ending) - possessive or case form of 'you'
ca (and) + eva (indeed) - compound particle meaning 'and indeed'
mad (from 'asmad' - I) + e (case ending) - first person singular possessive or dative
vai (indeed) - emphatic/sanctional particle
tu (but) - concessive particle, often contracted to tv
iva (like/as) - comparative particle
tat (that) + ā (locative adverbial suffix) - 'at that time'
tat (that) + am (accusative singular ending) - masculine accusative of demonstrative pronoun
tad (that) - demonstrative pronoun in neuter nominative
tad (that) + sya (genitive singular ending) - genitive form of demonstrative pronoun
tvam (you) + aṃ (ending for 2nd person singular) - 2nd person pronoun in nominative/accusative
kim (what) - interrogative pronoun in neuter form
tat (that) - demonstrative pronoun in neuter nominative/vocative
dṛś (to see) + tvā (absolutive suffix) - 'having seen', indeclinable absolute construction
sarva (all) + e (masculine plural ending) - 'all' in masculine plural nominative/vocative
ca (and) + api (also) - compound particle meaning 'and also' or 'even'
mad (from 'asmad' - I) + a (genitive ending) - first person possessive pronoun
hi (for/indeed) - causal particle, often contracted to hy in verse
tad (that) + am (accusative singular ending) - accusative form of demonstrative pronoun
saha (with) - postposition requiring following word to be in genitive case
evam (thus) - adverb derived from 'eva' (this/there) with accusative ending
yad (who/which) + e (plural ending) - relative/interrogative pronoun in masculine plural
katham (how) - interrogative adverb from 'kat' (question root)
punar (again) + ḥ (visarga ending) - adverb meaning 'again' or 'moreover'
yad (that/which) - relative/interrogative pronoun in neuter form
raṇa (battle) + e (locative singular ending) - 'in battle', locative case
iti (thus) + visarga (quotative ending) - concluding particle marking end of quotation
yad (who/which) + o (masculine singular ending) - relative/interrogative pronoun in masculine singular
aham (I) + ṃ (visarga ending in verse context) - 1st person pronoun in nominative/accusative
tad (that) + ān (plural accusative ending) - masculine plural accusative form of demonstrative pronoun
mad (from 'asmad' - I) + yā (instrumental ending) - instrumental case of first person pronoun
evam (thus) - adverb derived from 'eva' (this/so)
idam (this) + aṃ (neuter ending) - demonstrative pronoun in neuter singular
sā (from 'tad' = that) - feminine singular form of demonstrative pronoun
punar (again) - adverb meaning 'again' or 'then'
sa (from 'tad' = that) + o (ending for masculine singular) - masculine singular form of demonstrative pronoun

tvā (you) + yā (instrumental ending) - instrumental case of second person pronoun
yad (which) + at (neuter ending) - neuter form of relative/interrogative pronoun
etad (this) + a (masculine ending) + ṣa (prosthetic letter) - proximal demonstrative pronoun in masculine
te (they) + ṣām (genitive plural ending) - plural genitive of demonstrative pronoun
etad (this) - proximal demonstrative pronoun in neuter form
u (intensive prefix) + vac (to speak) + ā (perfect tense) + ca (aorist ending) - he/she said
tad (that) + āṃ (feminine accusative ending) - feminine singular accusative of demonstrative pronoun
ha (indeed) - exclamation or emphasis particle
tvam (you) - second person pronoun in singular
api (also) - cumulative particle, often used as enclitic
tāt (father) + a (vocative ending) - vocative form 'O father!' or 'dear'
a (past augment) + brū (to speak) + īt (3rd person singular ending) - he/she spoke (past tense)
nāman (name) + a (neuter ending) - 'name' or 'namely' (emphatic particle)
nitya (eternal) + aṃ (adverbial ending) - 'always' or 'eternally'
purā (before) - temporal adverb meaning 'in former times' or 'before'
yad (who/which) + aḥ (masculine singular ending) - masculine singular form of relative pronoun
tvā (you) + aṃ (accusative ending) - second person accusative pronoun

sma (past marker) - past tense marker in Sanskrit epic poetry
yad (who/which) + a (masculine ending) - masculine singular form of relative pronoun
prati (towards/against) - preposition meaning 'toward', 'against', or 'in return for'
mā (not) - prohibitive particle used with verbs in negative imperative
sarva (all) + ān (plural accusative ending) - masculine plural accusative of 'all'
kim (what) + aś (masculine ending with visarga) - masculine singular of interrogative pronoun
adya (today) - temporal adverb meaning 'today' or 'now'
śara (arrow) + aiḥ (instrumental plural) - 'with arrows', instrumental case
tan (to stretch) + a (present tense ending) - 'he stretches'
aham (I) - first person pronoun in nominative/accusative/vocative
bhū (to be) + et (optative ending) - 'may be' or 'should be', optative mood

ca (and) + api (also) + āy (enclitic ending) - 'and also' or 'even'
tat (that) + smāt (ablative singular ending) - ablative case of demonstrative pronoun
iha (here) - adverb of place meaning 'here' or 'in this world'

tat (that) + ac (for euphonic purposes) - variation of 'tat' with euphonic ending
tad (that) + au (dual ending) - demonstrative pronoun in masculine dual form
bhaga (fortune) + vān (possessing) - 'one who possesses fortune', epithet for divinity
etat (this) - proximal demonstrative pronoun in neuter form
kim (what) + e (plural ending) - masculine plural of interrogative pronoun
etad (this) + e (plural ending) - plural of proximal demonstrative pronoun

kim (what) - interrogative pronoun in neuter form

va (or) - alternative particle, often used as enclitic
